title: Search open tabs in Firefox
summary: "Search Tabs" in Firefox's tab menu lets you find a specific open tab.
html:
Firefox lets you find a specific tab when you have a lot of tabs open:

  1. Click the List all tabs button at the end of the tab bar.
    Note: If Vertical Tabs are enabled, click the List all tabs button in the toolbar.
  2. Click Search Tabs in the tab overview menu that opens.

You can also find specific tabs using the address bar. Type a % before or after your search term to filter the results to only open tabs.

Examples:

Results when typing % before the search term:

Results when typing % after the search term:

See the Address bar autocomplete suggestions in Firefox article for more options available in the address bar.
